content.description: Gets progressively more difficult until the crux right before the anchor.
content.location: Back right of the cave, starts on "Over the Transom", goes into "Low Jam", but then cuts up to a set of anchors instead of going further out into the cave.

content.description: Shorter bouldery route on the right side of the cave.
content.location: Lower start to the right of skinwalker direct (12d), joins up with that line and ends at the same anchor.

content.description: Shares the start with "Over the Transom 11d/12a", but after the 1st bolt break rightwards through steep climbing, with some powerful moves on mostly good holds. Persevere through the steepness to a difficult clip at the anchors, some kneebar trickery may help with the anchor clip. An extension to this is "Curious Jorge" 13c.
content.location: Starts off the back right side of the cave (same belay platform as "Over the Transom".  After the 1st? bolt, break rightwards thru steep climbing.

content.description: Starts bouldery, ends pumpy!
content.location: Right side of the cave if looking out from the back, climbs out on a shelf feature, then out into the cave.

content.description:
A unique journey across the back of the cave. Begin on 'Killer Bees', continue on reversing 'Low Jam', then downclimb 'Over the Transom' and step down onto the ground.

Another variation is "Black Rainbow" 14a which just starts on black ball instead.
content.location: Back of the cave

content.description:
Loose, and dirty, this uninspiring line is currently the easiest route in the cave.  However, due to the poor nature of the climbing and rock, it doesn't serve as a very good warmup.

Carefully move past 45 feet of suspect blocky rock until you can pull onto a ledge at 3/4 height.  Figure out a way to pull onto the crux headwall and negotiate sidepulls, flakes and more fragile rock to the top.

Belayer may want a helmet for this one.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.  60 meter rope will easily get you down.
content.location: Far left route at cave.

content.description: AKA "Visitor Q". A great line that features some really cool tufas as part of one of the cruxes.
content.location: Begins just to the right of cliffdweller, scramble up the boulder to the first bolt, has an obvious ledge feature 1/3 of the way up

content.description:
The warm up for the cave.  Start on mellow climbing on vertical rock for a few bolts, before encountering big moves on worse than they look holds.  Traverse rightwards through slopers and underclings, climbing straight up at the end to the first anchor.

At the start climb straight up, do not take the first set of bolts that breaks right.  This is "Grey Fox 12c".  If you continue climbing straight rightwards it is "Low Jam 13a".
content.location: Starts off the belay platform in the back right side of the cave (as you are looking into the cave).

content.description:
This is steep chossy cave climbing with a somewhat moderate grade at it's best.  While the line is incredibly steep, for most of it you are traversing and not actually climbing upside down.  Only the final bit involves true steep climbing.

Climb the majority of the warmup "Over the Transom" but instead of climbing up to the anchors continue traversing right and downwards in a few spots.  There is a great jug rest to recover on before climbing through the final steep section with an awesome and gymnastic crux.
content.location: Starts in the back right corner of the cave, shares start with "Over the Transom 11d/12a"

content.description: Similar to the Rainbow, start on Killer Bees but finish on Z-curve instead of heading down Transom. Good endurance climbing, with a punchy finish. A variation called "Black Ball-Z" 5.14b starts on Black Ball instead.
content.location: Start on Killer Bees, left side of the cave as looking in.

content.description: One of the earliest bolted lines in the cave, this route follows a near horizontal line of cracks, tufas, and pockets.
content.location: Starts to the right of Black Ball and Rick Ross, in the left side of the cave if looking in.

content.description: Fun endurance line on mostly good holds.  Start up "Baby Joe", but instead of clipping the anchors traverse right following the crack system.  Negotiate the first crux where the crack pinches down on slopers and a few crimps.  Get a quick shake and enter the second crux, where the feet disappear and the crack becomes sloping.  Get a decent hold and fight the pump thru the finishing 15 feet with better and better holds.
content.protection: Fixed draws to Anchors.  A few bolts will likely be skipped on redpoint.
content.location: From the finish of "Baby Joe" traverse right following the weakness in the overhanging corner system.

content.description:
This adds a fun boulder problem after finishing "Baby Joe".  From the anchors of "Baby Joe" clip the long sling and traverse left, get a good rest and tackle the physical boulder problem past two more bolts to the anchors.

Grade is somewhere between hard 12d and soft 13a.
content.location: From the anchors of "Baby Joe" clip the long sling and traverse left.

content.description: This route starts on the first two bolts of Skinwalker with a few overhanging moves to a ledge. and then traverses/walks the ledge right toward the top of a small pillar/tip type feature. Complete no hands rest. Then traverse right through the horizontal crack-ish type feature (this traverses through Baby Joe (12a)). Right after crossing through Baby Joe, you will find the crux as you head out the horizontal roof toward the lip of the cave past a handful of more clips.
content.location: Right side of Hurricave as you are looking at the cave from below. Venture up the hill passing the overhanging bulge start of Baby Joe to the next little bulging overhanging start.

content.description:
Start this big traversing journey with the same first couple bolts as 'Skinwalker' (right var). Split right, and climb up easy terrain along the left side of the big pillar. Enjoy the nice no hands rest at the top before traversing further right across 'Baby Joe', and up the harder dihedral crux (located only a couple feet to the right). Once established above, trend right and across the roof of the cave on the obvious rail system.

If you begin on 'Baby Joe' but execute the same dihedral crux and finish traverse, this is called 'Baby World' and is also 13c.
content.location: Begins to the left of the big pillar on the right side of the cave as you look in.

content.description: AKA Penthouse. Begin on Silver Fox, and follow the extension for a few more bolts of roof climbing and rightward traversing. This extension can be reached from the Skinwalker direct/ Skinwalker starts, and if done those ways is called Skin Trade/Big Man on Campus.
content.location: Back right of the cave

content.description: This route begins with a little scramble up some easy stacked boulders to get to the first bolt. You can sit down here for as long as you like and get ready for some great climbing on quality stone. The first three bolts are pretty cruiser with plenty of jugs to procrastinate on. After the third bolt this route really turns it on for the next 5 bolts and culminates with a really fun boulder problem. Collectively we were calling the the 4 move boulder problem V3-ish, which doesn't sound that hard for the redpoint crux of a 5.13a, but there really isn't anywhere to shake on this route. After the upper boulder problem you'll do a big move out left and stand up into an undercling crack feature. Climb this feature for one more bolt and chains.
content.protection: 9 bolts and 2 bolt anchor, new climb tech cables and steel biners installed 04/16
content.location: This route is on the left margin of the cave and is one of the most obvious lines you'll pick out as you approach. If you want shade I would suggest getting there before 11am or after 5pm.

content.description: Tiptoe through several bolts of moderate choss.  Roll out right onto an insecure sloper.  Build feet and fire up on jugs in still poor but much less fragile feeling rock to anchors.
content.location: Furthest route on the left with permafdraws at the bottom left of the cave

content.description:
This unique line is almost entirely leftwards traversing.  start with an easy climb into the overhanging corner system.  Traverse left past many bolts thru a variety of slopers, underclings, jams, and crimps.  The crux presents itself in getting to and clipping the anchors.  Much harder than it appears from the ground.

An extension of this "White Static" 13b continues past the anchors for a few more bolts with a tricky boulder problem to anchors shared with "Z Curve".
content.location: First route on the left side from the back of the cave.  Starts in the furthest left highest point of the cave.  The next route left (downhill) is "Killer Bees"

content.description: Starts off following the obvious rail to a couple of big moves into the bouldery crux/transition into killer bees (V9?) finish up on the last four bolts of killer bees to the anchor.
content.protection: 10 Bolts to shared anchor of Killer Bees
content.location: Between Rick Ross & Killer Bees

content.description: This route makes for a good warmup in addition to "Over the Transom"  Pull thru the initial bulge, probably best to use the first bolt or a stickclip if it's your first time  up.  Walk across the chossy ledge and start up on the steep face on mostly jugs past several fixed draws.  At the last bolt encounter the crux with sloping sidepulls and fingerlocks up the crack feature.
content.location:
Right side of the cave as you are looking into the cave.  Starts to the right of Skinwalker.  3rd line to the right of the warmup classic "Over the Transom".  To the right is "Outer World"

Start of a ledge in the middle of the approach trail.

content.description: Climb most of Cliffdweller until you reach the sloper rest before the last crux. Then traverse right and up, clipping 2 bolts before joining and finishing on Peregrination.
content.location: Sunny left side of the cave
